thread.title: School roundup: Red Raiders edge Dartmouth in field hockey
thread.title_full: School roundup: Red Raiders edge Dartmouth in field hockey

author: Cape Cod Times sports@capecodonline.com
title: School roundup: Red Raiders edge Dartmouth in field hockey
text: Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 11:12 PM By Cape Cod Times Posted Oct. 1, 2015 at 11:12 PM » Social News HYANNIS - Amanda Piknick scored twice and the Barnstable Red Raiders held off Dartmouth 3-2 in Old Colony League field hockey action to even their record on Thursday afternoon. Barnstable (4-4, 1-2 OCL) tallied all three goals in the opening half. Piknick opened the scoring from Mackenzie Curtice 10 minutes into the contest and made it 2-0 on an unassisted tally two minutes later. Beatriz DaSilva scored from Caroline Spalt with three minutes to play in the first half to give the Red Raiders a 3-1 lead. Mikayla Henderson excelled throughout in the midfield for Barnstable. Monomoy 9, Norwell 0: The Sharks are making their goodbye tour of the South Shore League an impressive one as they cruised to a lopsided win in Thursday’s misty, cold and blustery conditions in Harwich at the Monomoy Athletic Complex. Three Monomoy players accounted for all nine goals led by Brooke Wrightington’s four-score and two-assist performance. Hannah Potter added a pair of scores along with two assists and Carlee Tolley finished the day with a hat trick. Marina Small had a pair of assists for the Sharks (7-2, 5-1 SSL) as they dominated field position the entire afternoon. Monomoy only gave up one corner and just two shots in the entire game. VOLLEYBALL Sandwich 3, Falmouth 0: Caroline Clabault has 13 kills in six aces to lead the Blue Knights to an Atlantic Coast League sweep against the Clippers in East Sandwich. Sandwich won, 25-15, 25-13, 25-23. Caroline Wilson backed up Clabault with six kills and an ace, and Tessa Wood had four kills and a block. Kaylee Tolman and Liz Lorino anchored the Sandwich (6-2, 3-1 ACL) defense with 19 and 12 digs, respectively, and Abigail Bates tallied 26 assists. Hunter Engstrom had three kills for Falmouth (0-6). Kerry Shanahan had 10 digs, and Paige Meade had eight assists, By Cape Cod Times
